website_summaries.verdict: This inexpensive Fire TV Stick is an even more affordable option for anyone who doesn't want or need 4K streaming.
pros: Plenty of storage space for apps and games
Allows you to watch shows from the majority of streaming services
Can be paired with Bluetooth headphones or speakers
cons: While 1080p HD is plenty for some, many people prefer to pay a little extra for the full 4K experience

website_summaries.verdict: Amazon's cheap Alexa-powered stick is better than ever with a TV-control remote, but Roku's simple menus make it a better choice.
pros: The Amazon Fire TV Stick is one of the least expensive streamers you can buy
Voice features are best-in-class, and Echo and Dot owners can control it with Alexa
Its app selection is superb, responses are fast and video quality is as good as any streamer
The remote can control volume and power on TVs, sound bars and AV receivers
cons: The user interface promotes TV shows and movies from Amazon and its partners that you probably don't care about

customer_reviews.title: Be careful when gift giving!
customer_reviews.text: WARNING! I didn't realize that when you buy any Amazon device like this one (or a tablet, etc) it comes preloaded with your info. That's great. But if you gift it to someone else it has all your info, and they can buy & install apps, make in app purchases and so on. You then have to rely on them to figure out how to switch it to their Amazon account...if they even have one. EASY FIX. I guess I just needed to mark the "This is a gift" or the "This order contains a gift" box available on the Cart page.
customer_reviews.author: SashaSS

customer_reviews.title: Remote difficult to open and firestick keeps restarting and overheating
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the fact that I had to pry the remote open with a pair of my scissors. I wish there was a simpler way to open it. Maybe I did not possess the strength to push it open. Also my firestick restarts itself randomly. Support helped me and I thought it fixed it but it did not. It's overheating!! I've had these issues before but not straight out the box. Really upsetting.
customer_reviews.author: Mini

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade over first edition Fire Stick
customer_reviews.text: We owned the initial firestick and had used it regularly for years. A remote issue forced us to replace the unit, and I'm so glad we did! The responsiveness and speed of the new version is amazing! No more lagging or double click. The new remote is also a huge upgrade with the voice control option. It's a must have!
customer_reviews.author: bvanderpol

customer_reviews.title: So easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: This is an upgrade from my original firestick. The installation was so easy, Amazon is really good with their step by step instructions. It works perfectly but the thing I like even more than the voice control is the size of the remote. That original remote was ridiculously small and easy to loose.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Robbins

customer_reviews.title: amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I like to watch Amazon Prime or Netflix, this is my second fire stick, and I only spent 29.99! My TV HDMI interface is broken. I linked the fire stick to a converter so that I can continue to watch the programs I like. Both are easy to install and I am very satisfied with the results. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Seriously
customer_reviews.text: If I could get the back of the remote open so I put in the batteries in, I might actually like this product but I was unable to. I even viewed YouTube videos on how to put batteries but I still couldn’t get it open. Seriously, getting the remote open should be the easy part.
customer_reviews.author: Tumbleweed

customer_reviews.title: Does not support YouTube TV
customer_reviews.text: Product setup was quick and easy, but I was disappointed to find that this product does not support YouTube TV.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry S

customer_reviews.title: I love my Firestick remote!
customer_reviews.text: This lovely remote with Alexa does everything! I used to have to use 2 remotes: 1 to turn my tv on& off, and adjust the volume. My new Firestick remote died it all! I cam access all channels including Netflix, Amazon video.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Edwards

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, the only problem I have is it does not work without internet.
customer_reviews.author: Nannette Banker

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to Dumb TVs
customer_reviews.text: This is the second TV Fire stick I've purchased. The first one is on one tv set and the latest one is on another. The stick will pay for itself in less than four months, since I don't need to rent additional video boxes for the two TVs.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Hilsheimer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to connect and navigate
customer_reviews.text: My daughter bought this for me for Christmas and offered her boyfriend to set it up for me. I told her I was sure I could figure it out and I was right! Some things take more than one step to set up, like Spotify in my photo, which required the Alexa app first, but that was made clear and using Alexa is a breeze. It is so much nicer to watch TV and movies on my TV instead of my computer. I’m learning new things all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Figaro

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: PROS: I like it. Very Good Image on my TV...better than my COX CABLE! EASY setup. CONS: You have to PAY for many of the shows listed.
customer_reviews.author: Brigitte Coffman

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work. No sound.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk with no support. Out of 6 minutes watching tv, we only had sound for 2 1/2 minutes. I contacted Amazon MULTIPLE times for help. Was told over and over to reset the fire stick and my modem/router. Didn’t work. And heaven help you if you buy it somewhere besides Amazon. Then they really don’t care if it works or not. Still trying to get a refund for this POS. Wouldn’t own another if they paid me to take it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda McMurray

customer_reviews.title: Loses signal always!!
customer_reviews.text: Very bad product. I rarely used the device when I initially bought it. So moved the TV to the living room where the Firestick was connected. And 25 feet from the modem. While watching movies or videos keep freezing or stop playing. Other devices in the room are connected like a smart TV, wifi camera and tablets. The issue also happens even if there is only 1 device connected. I've done all the troubleshooting except the factory reset. This issue happens every day. Too bad my return window has passed and can't return it. This us my 2nd Amazon device in our home and I'm greatly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MARCO

customer_reviews.title: Much faster!
customer_reviews.text: Works much faster than the previous gen which is why I bought it. Nothing else seems to have changed much, I don’t find Alexa too helpful but otherwise I am happy I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: This is just my experience.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for about 1 week. Then it stopped. Screen went blank it would still turn on and turn off the TV and adjust the volume but nothing else. I used the troubleshooting advice that came from Amazon but it was unsuccessful. Right now I'm at a loss to get it to work so I'm returning it. When it worked, it worked great. But now it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Wallstrum

customer_reviews.title: Roku is better
customer_reviews.text: My Roku app is older, but it was chaeper than this and the Roku device is still faster than this "New Firestick" I can't watch the Spectrum TV that I subscribe to with this app. I spoke with tech support and they confirmed it. Many of the tv channel apps that say you can subscribe too with your cable provider's login either only offer a short free trial (like CBS) or they are not available from my provider. This device adds complications and frustrations to streaming TV. Don't waste your time or money on it if you just want to stream TV. Roku is easier, faster and better I do not like this product at all and regret the purchase
customer_reviews.author: michael j nappi

customer_reviews.title: I found far fewer free services available that I would have thought.
customer_reviews.text: I found far fewer free services available that I would have thought. 80%+ require you to purchase a subscription. If you pause the screen for longer than about five minutes, it reverts back to the home page and you have to go back through the selection process to get back to where you were. Video/Sound quality is very good.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD M COUTINHO

customer_reviews.title: No more cable bill!
customer_reviews.text: The Firestick works very well allowing us to “cut the cable”. We use WiFi, Firestick and Hulu Live for our tv viewing now. Perfect picture and audio, and many ( 61 for us) channels are available, including sports and entertainment. Only one drawback. Unlike ROKU, Firestick will not support streaming from cable should you want to do that so I assigned only 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: NC joan

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't open it: returned it.
customer_reviews.text: Would have liked to upgrade to the new Fire Stick, so that it had volume included on one remote. Unfortunately, we couldn't open the remote to install the batteries (included with purchase). Returned it. We are sticking to our first gen remote that we can easily open and just opting to use the tv remote for sound control. Save your money. The upgrade isn't worth the trouble of the pain of trying to open the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Thankful Grateful Blessed

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Awesome everything I need is on the firestick could not be happier
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Persohn

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in product's longevity
customer_reviews.text: I'm reposting this review after failed attempts to fix problem. At first I loved this product, everything was great. About a year later though it is full of glitches. The most annoying thing for me is when I'm browsing and the cursor just starts flying through when I'm not even pressing the button anymore . Sometimes a press in the opposite direction will make it stop but not always . Drives me crazy! I have been in contact with customer support several times, reset stick and remote separately, yet the problem always comes back . *Update* In addition to previous problem, apps now just open on their own!! Resetting to factory settings does not help. So frustrating!!
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Easy Cord Cutters Tool
customer_reviews.text: We have been getting steady increases in our Cable TV bill with no increases in services. So we thought we would cut the cord and this device became the focal point for making that transition. We are very pleased with the performance of this device. It is easy to setup with prompts provided as you power it up. We then added our favorite apps, (also very easy), and have never looked back at the Cable TV being gone. We now save over $100 a month without those charges for Cable TV. If you are thinking of making the leap into cord cutting, this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen H. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this less than 1 year ago, but it has now disappeared from my orders list. Do not buy this! Performance is horrible. I am now stuck on one channel because no matter how often I put fresh batteries in the remote, it will not work. It magically works periodically. It has been nothing but problems since the day I installed it, but Amazon would not let me return it. For reasons unknown it just quits working and I have to reset it frequently. Don't waste your money. This has NOTHING to recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This does not work as advertised unless U purchase the whole farm(maybe). Even the remote is a hassle to replace the batteries. The older model a fix it tool was recommended by the help community. The one with Alexa also is a pain to replace the batteries, best not to close the cover all the way. The program apps for free are not really free as they require a cable subscription to access the full features. Also spooling is a consistent problem as U wait for the programs to load. Very disappointed in this product and would not recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Terry W.

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: Fire stick is not much of an improvement over using the smartphone app and or Google Play to stream to our TV. We also had Prime Video on our DVD player which works better than the Fire stick.....but Amazon will no longer support that system after September. Finding videos and other shows to watch is harder on the Fire stick, even with voice search. . Wish there was a simple on screen method to locate what we want to watch. Sorry, I really wanted to like this device.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: I got my first fire stick as a gift for Christmas. Within two months the first one froze and stopped working. Amazon sent me a replacement last month. The replacement froze and stopped working. I was advised by Amazon customer service to return the sticks. They will either fix them or replace them but not offer money back for receiving defective items. After having two fire sticks that stopped working within three months I have lost confidence in Amazon products. My friends have the old fire sticks and they still work after having them a few years.
customer_reviews.author: LEM

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement
customer_reviews.text: Set up this Stick for my parents so they could have easier access to Amazon, Netflix and Hulu. Setup was easy as always. Wifi connection quality is worse that I am used to with Fire TV Sticks (I've probably owned 5-6 over the years). It also is not very responsive to user input. The one thing the setup wizard is missing is adding equipment to the fire TV. I had to spend a decent amount of time on Google until I found out you can add specific equipment like cable boxes. Wasted a lot of time for something that should have been simple. I also wonder how many people realize that this feature even exists.
customer_reviews.author: Texas

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a few weeks and then dies
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the new generation firestick. Ours wasn't even working a month before it died and I had to call for a replacement. Replacement has now since arrived and yet it's only been three weeks since we've been using it and guess what this one stops working to we have an old generation fire stick it seems to have no problem and has been working for 5 months. I'm not sure of all the issues the new generation fire stick has but I know this is frustrating all I want is one to work as well as the old generation Express trading calling customer service every other week.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda C.

customer_reviews.title: WiFi compatability?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 4k fire stick and it worked great until my router had to be replaced. New router easily was programmed into my "smart" TV and the internet is available but when I attempted to use the Fire stick the TV screen kept telling me there was no internet connection. I wonder if the stick is somehow programed not to work with other than the first router or (more likely) I did something wrong. None the less, the current stick is not functionable in my current set-up.
customer_reviews.author: frijadog

customer_reviews.title: WOW, Makes Cutting Cable Easy
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have bought this before anything else after cutting cable. It makes any monitor or digital TV a smart TV and even gets some local news channels using their apps. I would highly suggest to anyone to buy and it's worth every penny. User friendly, so easy setup and you can take it with you while traveling as long as you have internet service and WiFi wherever you stay. I plan on buying a few more for other TV's in our house.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Stinchcomb

customer_reviews.title: Apps available for a custom experience
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little streaming device. It allows you to load apps so you get a custom experience. When you first set it up it automatically signs you into Amazon Video, which is nice. I’ve only dabbled with the voice recognition so can’t really comment on that. I am disappointed that Vudu isn’t available on the App Store but Plex is so there is DLNA compatibility. We have had a couple of instances where the DLNA playback stopped due to the network being too slow, which doesn’t make any sense. My WiFi signal is pretty good where it’s situated and I have a MUMIMO router.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Fusco

customer_reviews.title: Good for lite tv service
customer_reviews.text: Does not support Xfinity or Comcast streaming, live network channels or network news feeds from CBS, NBC or ABC. What "CBS Now" & the other channels are offering thru Firestik are video services, not real tv. I spent 4 hours figuring this out with Amazon Firestik techs on the phone with me. I hope this review saves some people the same trouble. Comcast recommends a certain competitor's stik starting with Rok & ending with u sold here instead; it does all of the above!!! IT ROCKS!
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: Fire Stick Easy to Install and Use
customer_reviews.text: It was so easy to set up the new Fire Stick. The only thing I don't like about it is the fact that since it has an on and off button, when you use it to turn the Fire Stick off the TV turns off too. So instead of using the on/off button, I always have to put it to sleep and then use my Smart TV's remote to return to the HDMI the my DirecTV is connected to. Other than this it works really great and the Netflix and HBO Now Apps were really easy to download and use.
customer_reviews.author: Cecelia A. Lawshe

customer_reviews.title: Great way to cut the cable
customer_reviews.text: Hookup couldn’t be simpler - plug it in, connect, and watch! Seem to have all the apps I need. The remote is simple and easy to use, but with no way to access channels directly (number keys, etc.) there’s a lot of scrolling. Picture quality is great!
customer_reviews.author: WharfRat

customer_reviews.title: Menus suck.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like how you mix prime videos with those you have to purchase. They should be clearly separated.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I jumped through the hoops for nearly an hour with the service rep on Amazon Chat. After SEVERAL attempts to get this unit to work, the decision was made for me to return the unit for "repair". I got it back, SAME THING! The unit boots up and shuts back down. I have not had the use of this Fire Stick for a week or so. According to the service report, the unit was "tested and the latest software was loaded". Not sure why they didn't just send me a new device and turf this piece of junk of to a refurbisher!
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd G.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in the new Fire Stick. Alexa doesn't work very well and it seems like every channel is going to cost me a monthly fee. Going back to my old Fire stick
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install! One time cost, no monthly bill!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Firestick! I have a TV in my sewing room and didn’t want to pay a monthly cable bill for that room. This sounded like a great option and I was right! I can binge on Netflix or Prime video whenever I’m working on a project!
customer_reviews.author: Lani

customer_reviews.title: GREAT DEAL on this one!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon ran this for $24.99 a few weeks ago, so I went ahead and bought one to see what all the fuss was about. We absolutely love it! We cut the TV cord several months ago and we haven't been able to watch any of our regular TV shows. Now we have Directv Now App on the Firestick and we can watch our shows. We can also snuggle up and Netflix and Chill in our bedroom. My Wife is so happy I got this that she always wants to make love after our tv show. I am so happy!
customer_reviews.author: Skippy

customer_reviews.title: Over price my personal
customer_reviews.text: Its a nice product but my personal option is that its over priced. Amazon needs its customers to use this product to freely advertise there products we deserve a piece of the pie there are other Chinese made 4k streaming stick that are cheaper and let u stream netflix hulu youtube and guess what they don't advertise bloatware onto there customers. That's my personal opinion. We should be rewarded for every item or service we purchase through this amazon stick aka amazon self service cash register that everyone has in there home.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco De Leon

customer_reviews.title: Our third Fire TV Stick
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Fire TV Stick as a Prime Day special. The remote control is updated from our previous two units. There is now a power button and volume controls that operate the TV power and volume. The "Alexa" voice recognition works well. Installing apps is straightforward. It's a cost effective way to add streaming "smarts" to a basic HDMI television. I recommend Fire TV Stick. There's also a 4K version for higher resolution displays. The unit is well worth it at its normal price, but look for special pricing from Amazon on Black Friday, Cyber Monday, Prime Day, or other promotional campaigns.
customer_reviews.author: MJG

customer_reviews.title: Fire Stick with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: It is working just fine but it wasn't as simple to setup as I thought it would. Was it complicated? No it was not but it kept asking for a password and it was getting a lil frustrating. Once I got it all situated I have not had any other concerns. This is why I gave it a 4 and not a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Dee

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love my amazon fire stick! This actually the third one I have bought not because anything goes wrong but my grown children fall in love with it and take it. They now all have one so I will be able to keep mine. Voice recognition works well just don't hold it too close to your mouth. They possibilities are endless with this thing. Our internet is archaic (we live in the sticks) so ours buffers some but my children all have newer internet services and they have zero buffering.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup, access to what we want, not glitchy
customer_reviews.text: We love the Fire TV Stick! All we had to do was plug in to the HDMI port of our TV and use the remote for a simple setup. Instant access to Amazon Prime and Netflix since we have accounts. Access to ABC, CW, and TNT via the free apps through Amazon, and, if we want to get an account, Hulu. Fire TV Stick is not glitchy, user-friendly, and a great price!
customer_reviews.author: scimom

customer_reviews.title: Better than before!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Fire Stick. I gave my first (very basic) one to a friend when I got my second -- the one with the square "dongle" on it. I liked each of them, and each was better than the last. This one is much, much better - the best so far. It immediately recognized my TV and now I only need one remote to watch anything the is available on the Fire Stick. No more needing two remotes to turn everything on and off, or to adjust volume. The new Fire Stick does it all. And the Prime Day price of $14.99 was too good to pass up. You should buy one!
customer_reviews.author: Ginny MayTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Clunky at best , creator's hate kids or family with kids
customer_reviews.text: Home always shows programming that we are not subscribed to, but dose not show ones we are. Small remote get lost easy when small kids move it around, no rewind or fast forward in most shows. I understand no fast forward but come the fock on no rewind this is stupid. The person that decides this evidently does not have kids or just hates kids.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Useful addition to my streaming tool options
customer_reviews.text: I decided to purchase the Fire Stick primarily because the Prime video app on my older Roku did not completely integrate all of the channels I have through Amazon. Set up was very easy. It took about an hour to sign into the apps that I selected. The interface works well, but it's not as elegant or versatile as Roku's interface. Ads/recomendations are very intrusive because of their integration into the navigation process. Alexa voice control is hit and miss. Remote is easier to use. Streaming quality is excellent and very responsive. However I will continue to use my vintage Roku as well because of the channels that are available there but not on the Fire Stick.
customer_reviews.author: MikeCPI

customer_reviews.title: Like a brand-new TV!
customer_reviews.text: WHAT have I been missing!!! The Amazon Firestick delivered a whole range of great TV for the ridiculously low sale price of the little unit. It was easy to install, worked immediately, and I will never, ever pay for 3,043 entirely useless cable channels again. I LOVE IT.
customer_reviews.author: Yotie

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!  Terrible Product, Deliberately Cheap and Limited Functions!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was OK, and have two of them, and watched MLB.tv all last year and this one, until I found out just how CHEAPLY it's made and just how much I've missed on MLB.tv using them! MLB has split screen, which works on everything including my Xbox One and AppleTV, but NOT on this over-priced piece of CRAP! There is NO GOOD REASON for these Fire TVs to NOT HAVE the same features all other usable devices do, except for Amazon being a really lousy, greedy and crappy company supplying a horribly-bad product like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sher Lock

customer_reviews.title: Amazon does not SUPPORT VUDU!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product specifically for the use in my gym. While you can "sideload" the product, it is difficult to manage and not accessible by alexa (another reason to purchase.) Anyone wanting to use this to stream any of their VUDU library - be aware, you will be disappointed. I am returning because of this.
customer_reviews.author: Mommydba

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: Keeps freezing / loading / buffering when trying to watch Showtime or Netflix. Netflix also looks pixelated. Fire stick gets super hot after minutes of use. I'd much rather use my Roku this thing is a piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Having problems and cannot get product support
customer_reviews.text: I have two. Ist one is ok, 2nd one I have had for 3 weeks. within the last 4 days it has started to spontaneously reboot every 20 to 30 minutes. I got online yesterday and went to product support for this item. It opened up a chat window. Waited almost a hour with no response so I pushed the button to have representative call me back. I waited almost a whole day with no call. Got online 30 minutes ago. Opened same chat window. Still no response. Asked for a callback again. Wonder how long I will have to wait? Based on problems with this Firestick I would not recommend anyone to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Allen O'Neal

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. At first I was really disappointed that it hap to be plugged into the tv and the wall for power. I was able to plug the hdmi and the power cord USB into the tv and it worked! I am able to finally watch all the things that I couldn't (like Disney+) download because my tv is a few years old and all my apps can be in one place. Plus I got it for $20 close to black Friday. You do have to download the apps you want and also log into all your accounts (Netflix/Hulu) but once you set it up your good to go.
customer_reviews.author: sarahmarie

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk, always has trouble connecting to the internet even though no other device in my home ever does 🙄 Will stop every 15 min in the middle of a show and spin in a circle trying to reconnect to the internet. Can't understand voice commands half the time and whatever you search for it will always go to Amazon prime first and try and get you to pay to watch it instead of offering the free version on Netflix or Hulu which we also have subscriptions too. We are about to throw this piece of junk in the garbage and get a Roku!!
customer_reviews.author: shertherapy

customer_reviews.title: Works with projectors!
customer_reviews.text: We just installed a projector in our basement. while it was connected to DirecTV, I needed to be able to stream Netflix, Amazon Prime Video, Disney +, etc. for my grandkids. I tried connecting 2 different devices, including fire cube, but they wouldn’t connect. I purchased this Fire Stick, plugged it into one if the HDMI inputs, and it immediately started the connection process. I was a little nervous when it asked for the brand of TV, but was pleasantly surprised to see it it offered options for projectors, including mine! I’m so happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: JTC

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely LOVE my Fire TV Stick!
customer_reviews.text: Free TV and movies on Prime. A seemingly endless amount of choices. No commercials unless you use one of the other free channels available. Even then the commercial breaks are usually two to four ads long. You can purchase subscriptions to many of the premium channels if you wish, including HBO, Cinemax, Starz, Sling or HULU or NetFlix. The streaming is seamless--no buffering or pixelation or blurriness. Clear picture. Easy to use and a user-friendly home page. The best part is now there's Alexa to help you find what you looking for--whether its on Prime or not.
customer_reviews.author: G. E. Glaum

customer_reviews.title: Great app choices, nice set up...overall great streaming device choice.
customer_reviews.text: Coming from Apple TV, Roku player and xBox. I love the simplicity and user friendly approach of the Amazon Firestick. The Alexa function is great...being able to use your Amazon Echo As well as view your Ringmaster Doorbell on the TV screen is great. Set up isn’t difficult. However it take time to download the apps and confirm their “purchase” on amazon. They are free. The control is simple to use. The voice feature is a plus...not to mention not it has a power button along with volume. Out off all the streaming platforms. I find this one to be user friendly and simplistic for anyone to use yet still eye catching.
customer_reviews.author: A Fam of Smart Shoppers

customer_reviews.title: No Signal?
customer_reviews.text: I got a new Amazon Fire TV/Stick for Christmas. Couldn't believe how easy it was to set up. Love it..... except at times, there is no signal and I have Wi-Fi. I always go back thru my steps, select the correct mode, and press the home button. After a few seconds, it flashes "No Signal". Are you having trouble with your internet? And I DO have a subscription! What do I need to do? Is there anything I can do?
customer_reviews.author: Giselle Richards

customer_reviews.title: Not so fired up about Fire Stick
customer_reviews.text: Even though I have one of the fastest cable services (200Mbits/sec) for home use and wireless modem Linksys AC1900 mu-mimo there is still pausing and broken streams; worse than with my older D-Link DAP1525 media modem link.. Fire Stick needs a Very Strong wireless signal (better than three bars) to achieve 1080P standards..It seems like the video bandwidth is sacrificed for the voice recognition add on which in my case is not needed.. There are start data streaming pauses ,resolution distortion, bit drop outs and delays occur. Connection to HDMI, power and setup user interface was easy...but user GUI resembles android/ Google interface. Thanks Amazon... but.... Not all fired up about Fire Stick....
customer_reviews.author: William L. Jones

customer_reviews.title: DOESN’T DIGITIZE LIKE VERIZON FIOS TV
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to cut the cord; however, I was tired of paying for Verizon FIOS that digitized almost daily. Fios customer service solution was to charge me to fix their service. After researching streaming services and alternatives, we bought 2 FireTV sticks and 1 4K Fire Stick. Returned FIOS Cable boxes June 1, 2019. Surprisingly, video quality is GREAT WITHOUT DIGITIZING. This wasn’t about paying less but about service quality. We’ve had FireTV one month and so glad we switched. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.author: Gabe D.

customer_reviews.title: easy to figure out for an inept tech person
customer_reviews.text: so far i love my amazon fire. i don't have to worry about paying my outrageous cable bill. i can sit back and pick what i want to pay for and watch what i want when i want. i had Alexa on my pc and i am sorry to say she is really dumb. but Alexa on my amazon fire is totally awesome she can figure out what i want, even with my crazy descriptions. needless to say i uninstalled Alexa on my pc. amazon fire is so worth getting. i am really enjoying it. it has given me independence from the cable company that was bleeding me dry and opened up a whole new world for me.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Ashley

customer_reviews.title: What's to like about the firestick?
customer_reviews.text: My firestick lies unused for three weeks. It worked once (3 days) then simply stopped with notices about Home not available, Internet not available, etc. At one point Amazon techs were trying to get it to work but something cut our connection. I assumed the tech would call me - I did not have his number - but nobody seemed to care. Another problem was that all the worthwhile channels like Fox News require a membership of some kind. For me, the firestick is useless. Kindly give me a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Geraild J MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality Picture
customer_reviews.text: Not only does it create a bold and colorful picture it is very easy to use. If I had known that it was this easy to use I would have bought it a long time ago. The only drawback is the CBS and NBC Fat Cats do not play well with others. I had the 100 series on my Fire Stick just a couple of weeks ago and now the big networks have taken it away. If the poor man gets a break then the fat cats take it away. Nothing but GREED. I really like the Fire Stick though and I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny R Parson

customer_reviews.title: Great option with a couple suggestions for improvement
customer_reviews.text: Streaming was great and the options on Fire TV are great. I haven't used Alexa a lot, but when I have, it's been successful. My only gripe is with the actual remote...it'd be great if there could be a "last channel" button for streaming live tv. It'd also help to have an "info" button to get more information about what is currently streaming on those tv channels. I also think there should be an easier way to put the Fire TV stick to "sleep" instead of having to go all the way to the home screen to the top, all the way over to settings, then finally getting to the "sleep" option.
customer_reviews.author: FlipFlopLove

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff, would consider buying the 4k version next time
customer_reviews.text: I definitely love it, especially the remote controller. I also own the apple tv 4th generation. Honestly speaking, I like this remote controller more than the apple one because the trackpad on apple remote controller is hard to use and navigate for me. My only gripe is that this model is a bit slow, and you can feel the lagging when clicking through the menu, especially when exiting the app and returning to the home page. I would consider going for the 4k version even if I have a 1080p TV for that the 4k version runs faster and can bring a more smooth experience.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Remote stops working.
customer_reviews.text: I've now had two remotes that have stopped working within a few months. It isn't worth it to me to buy another, may try a roku.
customer_reviews.author: Beth B.

customer_reviews.title: works inconsistently.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon, are you in or out... lets get it working right all the time before you worry about the next gen or new and improved... since installing Fire stick... my experience is that . some apps open then they dont, some start then stop (including prime) and the stremaing is consistnely interupted with stop/starts (reloading?) I also use roku on other tvs, they dont have these issues (but rokuj is not perfect-doesnot like amazon prime video)
customer_reviews.author: The Critic

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Streaming Device!
customer_reviews.text: As the owner of two older Sony Bravias, I was extremely happy that Amazon offered a device at a discount to allow me to continue streaming Prime video content as Sony no longer provided support for the Widget apps on my televisions. I'm not ready for new televisions, so this little device delivered just what I need! Actually, it delivered more than I had hoped! There are some terrific apps for this device! I will be purchasing another Fire Stick in the near future. The quality of the device and the picture display is superb. No buffering at all. Installation was a breeze and we were streaming within minutes! Thank you Amazon!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Bowles

customer_reviews.title: functional but a little slow and NO YOUTUBETV
customer_reviews.text: I chose this over a Roku for my dumb TV. It works fine and has plenty of apps, but can sometimes be a little slow to respond. Then I decided to switch from Hulu to Youtubetv. Unfortunately, there is no application or channel for Youtubetv for the firestick. I don't know if it's because of a little tiff between a couple of billion dollar companies or what, but there it is. I bought a smart Roku TV. The dumb TV with the firestick has been relegated to another room where it is rarely used. Update: Added a star as the big companies finally made up and youtubetv is now available on firestick
customer_reviews.author: West Texas

customer_reviews.title: No screen mirroring.
customer_reviews.text: No screen mirroring......really? This thing is awesome, and you leave that out. This is hard to give 3 stars because it's a definite improvement. However, it's like running in a race and stop before you get to the finish line. Amazon, can you hook up, the next software update with the screen mirroring......?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A+++ Perfect Just What I Need Easy to Set Up but You Need Different Passwords Handy Gets NFL Ticket
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had gotten this years ago. For what I am using this for, there are no additional monthly costs. I'm using this primarily to watch Netflix, Amazon Prime Movies and surprise NFL Sunday Ticket! This is super easy to set up which I also was surprised at but you need to have on hand- they should tell you this ahead of time but they don't unless I missed something: 1. The wireless network number you're on, the network key that connects you to that network, the user names and passwords on apps that you might want to add like NFL SUnday Ticket, Netflix, etc. If you have that its easy.
customer_reviews.author: HershonJones

customer_reviews.title: These devices are BAD, BAD, BAD!,
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased four of these devices within the last year. Currently one of the four is operational. They are a completely unreliable product. Since we stream all our TV when one goes kaput...no TV viewing. Enough is enough. I’m trashing these pieces of crap and ordering three Roku streaming stIcks. UPDATE: The fourth and final Amazon fire stick went kaput. I now have four Roku devices. They are wonderful!! Much more user friendly units than the Amazon fire sticks and MUCH MUCH more reliable. All four fire sticks have been tossed into the trash. Buy Rokus!
customer_reviews.author: GLMamerow

customer_reviews.title: Longevity?
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept but hate the longevity of the product! I’m on my 5th or 6th one! I’m really getting tired of having to replace these things. Bought 2 this last time and one has already failed.....return window closed last month. Not a happy camper. My customer loyalty dates back 17,18 years or more. Yours lasts 30 days!
customer_reviews.author: S. Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Fire stick
customer_reviews.text: It says unable to update your Fire TV stick and it tell me to unplug and plug it back up and going to keep constantly doing that so that's why I'm returning the firestick for replacement
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Miller Jr

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup works great
customer_reviews.text: We did not have cable set up in our bedroom so after doing some research I ordered the Amazon Fire TV Stick with all-new Alexa Voice Remote, streaming media player. I am very pleased with this purchase the instructions are very easy to read and the on screen instructions guide you on how to connect to your wifi and your Amazon account. it just took about 15 minutes. Now we can watch Prime Movies and TV, Netflix and listen to Prime Music in our bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: MELVIN JONES

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: It constantly needs rebooting, I am guessing that it overheats behind a TV and stops responding. This was a problem with the last generation model too but now it's worse. the Alexa interface is the most awkward thing I deal with and it's horrible at recognizing different accents.. I have no problem getting Google to understand me... but Alexa is infuriatingly bad It's faster than the previous generation is the only good thing and luckily I got it on black Friday sales.. it works well when it's not overheated.. make sure that you put it to sleep when you are finished or it will overheat and stop responding otherwise
customer_reviews.author: Kemistry

customer_reviews.title: Bought for Disney+ for my Vizio
customer_reviews.text: I have a smart TV, but the Vizio smartcast is not compatible with Disney+ at this time. I was desperate to launch it for my family. I only purchased this for Disney+. The hardest part of setting it up was trying to hook it into the TV. For some reason i couldn’t get it into the HDMI plug. I finally got it in, and set up was a breeze. Took about 7 minutes to completely set up after i got it hooked in. Can’t wait to watch Disney+!!!
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: We love ours!
customer_reviews.text: Our little Fire TV Stick has been great! It has made so many new apps that even our 2018 model Sony smart TV cannot provide us. I bought it for a older Samsung smart TV that we have that only offers limited options for apps, and it has been so much fun watching movies from our home network, streaming TV shows from HGTV and other network apps, and playing some of the games. We did have some lag issues with wifi (even though we have an excellent router with a very strong signal), and so I bought the ethernet adapter, which has eliminated our lag. I couldn't be more pleased with this product!
customer_reviews.author: M. Ed.

customer_reviews.title: works good enough that I ordered 2 more
customer_reviews.text: There is a steep learning curve on how to use the remote. Alexa does not have a lot of knowledge. Hulu does not work like normal, Alexa doesn't know how to load a series page to browse through the episodes. I have to go through three different menus to get to the series I am looking for. But the streaming quality is great. The web browser kinda stinks, so I don't use it. Also, a big plus is that the volume is loud enough to actually hear my programs. I purchased 2 more as gifts for family.
customer_reviews.author: W. Frazael

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps a bad Firestick??
customer_reviews.text: Since Amazon states that they will no longer support the Amazon Prime App on my Panasonic TV I was encouraged to buy the Firestick. Set up was easy and it looked like it might work. However, into the second episode of the evening, the picture started pixelating and then buffering. We received a pop up notice that our Internet connection was slow. Hmmm... Change back to the TV's App and no problem whatsoever. Multiple attempts to use the Firestick including reinstalling, re-setting, changing routers, extending the connecting cords all failed. Firestick has been sent back for a replacement. Will update after the new product arrives.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Faster great remote Alexa enabled Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old fire stick because it seemed to be getting slow after many years of use. We adopted the echo/ALEXA system in our house and this further encouraged my purchase of this new model. The setup is easy love how it comes preloaded with some software. The remote is the highlight voice works almost as good as our echos. It could be better but the remote being larger is what I like and it Does volume and power for the TV for us cord cutters that’s Amazinnnnng! This unit is atleast two or three times faster than the original fire sticks!
customer_reviews.author: Clint R.

customer_reviews.title: Make your dumb TV a Smart TV
customer_reviews.text: What's not to love about Amazon's Fire Stick?! This is actually the second one I've purchase because I'm too lazy to move the one in my living room to the bedroom when I want to stream Netflix. I especially like how this newer version has volume control on the remote - I no longer have to keep 2 remotes by my bedside! Amazon's Fire Stick can make any TV with an HDMI port a smart TV! Just connect it to your wi-fi and you'll be able to stream almost anything through a variety of apps. I am waiting for my contract to expire with my TV provider before cancelling it. Then I plan to go 100% streaming. Thanks Amazon :)
customer_reviews.author: SadieTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Works as described.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second firestick. This one is much better than the first because you can control the volume and turn the TV on and off with this one remote. The first one couldn't do all of that so you still had to have the TV remote close by. Also there was something wrong with the first that caused the sound to become loud and sound like a diesel engine. I had to remove the power connector so the stick would reset. This new firestick hasn't had any problems with its operations, plus the extras (compared to the first). I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: C. C. Faison

customer_reviews.title: Fie Stick 2nd Gen easy to setup, easy to use with added features.
customer_reviews.text: The Fire stick was very easy to setup right out of the box and I like that Amazon added the ability to connect with the TV for sound mute and level. Internet connection was a non issue too. The stick is a great device to add smart TV to a non smart with HDMI TV. The plus is easy to set up, great design and size, works as shown in Amazon ad. The Cons are wish it were able to add extra memory for additional storage. Not having to power the stick separately.
customer_reviews.author: RPD

customer_reviews.title: Do. Not. Buy.
customer_reviews.text: Switching back to my 5 year old Chromecast. Bit the bullet and decided to upgrade to a Firestick and it’s been nonstop problems. Alexa worked for the first day then stopped after that. Every movie, show, song I play (Prime, Spotify, Netflix, Hulu) it buffers constantly. It takes me triple the time to watch anything because of the amount of buffering. Internet connection is fine, and can stream the same content on my phone and laptop with zero buffering. Wish I could have returned this to save the money and headache. Consider Chromecast or Roku before buying this. Unless you enjoy watching a 30 minute show over the course of 3 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Hinson

customer_reviews.title: What was once good has turned to crap.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon is failing to maintain their tech. The Fire Stick worked great when it came out, but now struggles to produce minimal service. It's slow, often dysfunctional in navigation controls, sometimes it just quits and you have to turn your TV off to regain control. Fire Stick in combination with the disastrous performance - from dysfunctional audio sync. (IMBd), repeated freezing of streaming (IMBd and Tablo) and poor commercial splicing with parts of streaming in the commercial - is an entertainment frustration nightmare that leaves you more tense trying to coax minimal functionality out of the combination system - than before you started. Really, Mr. Bezos you're not minding your shop.
customer_reviews.author: Durwood M. Dugger

customer_reviews.title: Buy extended warrenty
customer_reviews.text: The firestick itself is okay. The remote just stopped working 6 months after we bought the firestick alexa voice remote combo. We use the firestick about 2x a week. We tried all suggestions from customer service. In the end they told us they could not help us or replace the remote and we would have to purchase an additional remote which averages 25.00-30.00. They did offer a 15% credit for the remote. Buy the extended warranty if you buy this product. I did not want to chance buying the remote and it having the same defect as the one I have. Very unhappy and will be switching to a roku.
customer_reviews.author: erika

customer_reviews.title: Welcome to a whole new world!
customer_reviews.text: My family and I love it! Since the Nintendo Wii no longer supported Amazon Prime, Netflix, hulu we had to find something so we could continue watching these streaming services. So, I ordered the firestick w/Alexa remote. This has opened up a whole new world for us, so much to use (if you have a subscription to like hbo, cinemax, etc..) but you can also listen to music. It took maybe 10 mins for me to set it up, very easy to do also. I could go on and on with all that the firestick does but, all in all we are very happy and Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: nrow34

customer_reviews.title: Desperately needs cooling system
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Love the convenience! Apps are fairly handy and decent to navigate. CONS: Tiny remote. Small QWERTY keyboard for searches/accounts/passwords needed. Picture quality is meh when streaming from Netflix about 80% of the time. Apps (especially DISH Anywhere app) freeze and get frustrating. HUGE CON: NEEDS COOLING SYSTEM!!! This is my reason for 2-stars. I shouldn't have to run a fan directly on the dongle to be able to use the product. Overheating causes a host of problems that are easily solved with ventilation. Heat and electronics... c'mon! Work it out and offer a rebate to 1st gen buyers. I'll buy one that works without having to run a fan on it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fire TV Stick Changed Our Lives for the Better!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about the Amazon Fire TV Stick. It keeps all my online streaminbg Apps together in one place, it navigates perfectly, the Alrxa voice recognition is a life saver, and it is synced with all our other home devices, like our echo dots, music, etc. It;s such a relief to not have to go to Redbox, or even a theater, really on the weekend to search for a movie. You can access hundreds or thousands of movies instantly. You can access all your tv shows. It is so much less expwnsive than cable. It is great! Plug and play! And we can use it through the entire house! I love my Fire Stick. It is a game changer!
customer_reviews.author: Carly Leslie

customer_reviews.title: WANT TO BUY MORE!
customer_reviews.text: I had three more in my cart for Prime Day but they disappeared and now out of stock 9 hours into the two day event? I'm gonna be really irritated if I missed out on Prime day promo due to lack of stock.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Robichaud

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I've hemmed and hawed over getting the Fire TV Stick to try out for a few years now, unsure about the ability of our DSL Wi-Fi to work the thing. Verizon quit installing and our area is orphaned from FIOS, unfortunately ... a shame for the school kids needing the speed. But I got the Stick while on-sale and installed it without much ado and got it calibrated and updated and online and WOW!! TV, movies, music, whatever you like! Can't beat digital signals with video or sound! Super easy to get going, intuitive remote control. Thanks Amazon. I didn't mark Alexa items as I do not have or use it. Old guy, old-school push-button. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Cuffy

customer_reviews.title: A Learning Process
customer_reviews.text: I haven't yet figured out to get Alexa to fulfill a spoken request, which is the only reason I do not give this product 5 stars. I have tried several times. She just ignores me. But the fire stick and remote work fine when I do not try to use Alexa. So far, I have enjoyed browsing through the many selections available through the Fire stick. I did add Hulu for access to live television. Reception is great through my dsl cable and wireless router. When it stormed this weekend, I did not loose television reception as I formerly did with satellite TV.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Thistlebottom

customer_reviews.title: TOO MANY APPS NOT SUPPORTED BY FIRE TV STICK
customer_reviews.text: The fire stick works well and supports lots of apps but I was disappointed in the number of apps not available on the fire stick...They just removed HBO GO too...You have to subscribe to HBO NOW thru Amazon to get it now but I won't pay an extra $15.99 for that..... No CINAMAX, FOX NOW, GOOGLE PLAY STORE, APPLE TV, PEACOCK, DISNEY + and so many more not compatible... I think ROKU would be a better streaming device or use both... I get most of my TV the old school way through my cable company, SPECTRUM...Lots of their apps are not compatible...Or should i say supported... Very disappointed in that part...
customer_reviews.author: V. McCurry

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy - Well Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Roku 4K Streaming Stick+ with this. The difference was amazing. The Amazon Fire UI is *much* better and easier to use. The remote has Power, Volume Up/Down, and Mute buttons, and it was a snap to set it up to control my entire system (LG TV and Sony Soundbar). But the *best* feature I've discovered so far? With the Roku, the video remained static when you FF or Rewound, so you had to constantly "guess" where the commercials ended and the show resumed. Very frustrating. The Amazon Fire Stick displays a speeded-up version of the video which allows you to "see" where the program resumes. MUCH better!
customer_reviews.author: BluesBrother

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a replacement for my original Firestick 1st gen. Super easy setup....Love the sync function...synced it with my acct so all the shows in my watch history on Prime showed up on my new Firestick....along with all of my apps listed...I just had to click on each one to download them to the new device. The new remote has power and volume controls for the tv...so no longer need to have the tv remote out. If you have Prime...Firestick is the way to go....all of my pictures that automatically download to Amazon pics from our cell phones, can be viewed on the tv from the Firestick.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M

customer_reviews.title: Battery compartment way too hard to open.
customer_reviews.text: This may be a wonderful product but why do you have to make the remote battery compartment so hard to open? I have to wait for my grandson to come over to see if he can open it. Update to my original review: my 31-year-old grandson was finally able to get the battery compartment open on the remote. It took a steak knife prying it open at the slot in the back; it was like it was glued! Since he got it open, now it slides open easily and it is a fine product. I no longer have to run my streaming through my computer! Yay! I’d give it 5 stars except for the initial difficulty with the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasts less than a year
customer_reviews.text: This was my 2nd fire stick, the first one lasted almost a year, this one, about 7 months. Worked fine yesterday, today, I it wouldn't work at all. Put in new batteries, check, unplug to reboot, check, still nothing. I have a sony bravia tv, it's not new, but not old either. For some reason, these fire sticks don't seem to work very long. I bought the warrantee this time, but wasn't able to locate who I need to talk to very quickly, so will try again to obtain some sort of service. I would say this works great, when it works, but it just doesn't work very long.
customer_reviews.author: xDebx

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: I am NOT technical savvy. It is for this reason that I kept delaying to cut the cord with Xfinity Comcast. Until I couldn't stand it anymore. I googled about all the streaming options, read a lot of Youtube how-to's, and people's reviews. Finally, I placed the order of an Amazon Firestick and then when it arrives I ordered Sling. BOOM. Everything was setup in less than 30 mins. My fear is actually and literally self-imposed. The set up is super self explanatory and I cut my TV bill by about $80 a month. Very easy on screen set up, the firestick came with printed instructions and you can find tons of HOW-TO videos on Youtube. Love saving money! Yay!!
customer_reviews.author: C Y

product_meta.title: Fire TV Stick streaming media player with Alexa built in, includes Alexa Voice Remote, HD, easy set-up, released 2019
feature_bullets: The #1 best-selling streaming media player, with Alexa Voice Remote (2nd Gen, released 2019).
Use the dedicated power, volume, and mute buttons to control your TV, soundbar, and receiver.
Watch favorites from Netflix, YouTube, Prime Video, Disney+, Apple TV, HBO, and more. Stream for free with Pluto, IMDB TV, and more.
More storage for apps and games than any other streaming media stick.
Experience tens of thousands of channels, apps, and Alexa skills, plus browse millions of websites using Firefox or Silk.
Alexa on Fire TV provides the most comprehensive voice experience of any streaming media player.
Amazon Prime members get unlimited access to thousands of movies and TV episodes.
No cable or satellite? Watch live TV and sports with subscriptions to Hulu, Sling, YouTube TV, and others.
Pair with compatible Bluetooth headphones to listen to movies and music.
